description: In theory, a growing economy and tighter labor market mean increasing competition among employers, which should push wages up. That's still not happening. Plus. Time Warner Cable and AOL merged 15 years ago, and almost immediately fell behind the times, partly due to the culture clash that occurred when old and new media became one. Also: President Obama proposes making two years of community college free. What would that accomplish?
byline: Nancy Marshall-Genzer, Mitchell Hartman, Sally Herships, Kai Ryssdal, Steve Kelley, Gigi Douban, Nova Safo and Marketplace Weekend Staff
title: Marketplace for Friday, January 9, 2015
teaser: In theory, a growing economy and tighter labor market mean increasing competition among employers, which should push wages up. That's still not happening. Plus. Time Warner Cable and AOL merged 15 years ago, and almost immediately fell behind the times, partly due to the culture clash that occurred when old and new media became one. Also: President Obama proposes making two years of community college free. What would that accomplish?
